docs.snippet: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s decision to change its ban for athletes caught doping from two years to four has focused attention on the diligence of countries’ drug testing programs....
docs.lead_paragraph: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s decision to change its ban for athletes caught doping from two years to four has focused attention on the diligence of countries’ drug testing programs.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column notes that Anti-Doping Agency's decision to double the duration of bans for athletes who intentionally use performance-enhancing drugs to four years from two, has focused attention on the diligence of countries' drug testing programs in lead-up to Olympics; cites Jamaica as place where lax testing standards allow athletes to freely dope outside of competition, sometimes gaining lasting benefits.

headline.main: Doping Rules Are Tougher Only if Applied
headline.print_headline: Doping Rules Are Tougher Only if Applied

docs.abstract: The merger of American Airlines and US Airways now appears all but certain. | A 9-year-old girl may change the way nonprofits are run. | Fantex, the start-up promoting initial public offerings of football stars, said it was putting off its stock offering of Arian Foster.

headline.main: Airline Merger on Track to Close
